channel.title: Making a .JAR
channel.description:
Could someone here help me out by giving my a step by step guide or a tutorial on how to make your server into an executable .JAR file? This would really help me a lot, thanks!
-TeleNubby[br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2007, 01:26:51 PM[/size][hr]-[br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2007, 02:04:14 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone help?

item.title: Making a .JAR
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Sorry for the double/triple posting. I just really need an answer… :S

I’ll try to stop now, but is there like a bump feature to bump the topic if it goes too far down the list? And does anybody have an answer to my question?

Read full topic

item.title: Making a .JAR
item.dc:creator: @i_ancients_i i ancients i
item.description:
@i_ancients_i wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:1, topic:117763”]Could someone here help me out by giving my a step by step guide or a tutorial on how to make your server into an executable .JAR file? This would really help me a lot, thanks!

-TeleNubby[br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2007, 01:26:51 PM[/size][hr]-[br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2007, 02:04:14 PM[/size][hr]Can anyone help?[/quote][quote=“TeleNubby, post:3, topic:117763”][quote author=wicked pker link=topic=167030.msg1553936#msg1553936 date=1183081123]
dont double post and try using the perfect compiler it make sjar files for you
[/quote]
I’ve tried… it says the runserver.bat is the “jar file…” But when I run it , it doesnt work anyways…
So i need to know how to make .jar file because I’m trying to make a webclient. :S[br][size=1]Posted on: June 28, 2007, 02:44:25 PM[/size][hr]K i have to go for a bit - Hope I can get some replies in the time[/quote] argg stop double/triple posting -.-
